Key Arguments: The submission criticizes the overwhelming amount of information provided in the legislative documents, suggesting it is a distraction and difficult to digest.
The author questions the motivations behind corporate support for political stances, implying that such support may be a form of propaganda or lobbying.

The submission emphasizes the importance of freedom of speech as outlined in Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, suggesting that the proposed legislation may infringe upon this right.
Main Themes: Freedom of Speech and Human Rights
Notable Quotes: Information overload is the state of feeling overwhelmed by the volume of information to the point at which one feels more confused than knowledgeable about a particular topic.
Having dispensed with the 500+ pages, I believe that the Misinformation, Disinformation Bill is best resolved by examining Article 19 of United Declaration of Human Rights.

Without freedom of speech, individuals could not criticize government officials, test their theories against those of others, counter negative expression with a different viewpoint, or express their individuality and autonomy.
